ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does choice have an automatic notification email - is not, can I set one up?
ResponsesInList.Text: You could look at the event monitoring subscription for this. Also See https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Event_monitoring There is an event called "Choice answer added" in the events list /report/eventlist/index.php You would initially need to create an event monitoring rule for this event. Then anyone subscribed to that event can get a notification every time a choice has been made. Teachers, non-editing teachers and managers by default will be able to access event monitoring in their Preferences page. For students to be able to subscribe, you would first need to override their permissions for "Subscribe to event monitor rules tool/monitor:subscribe" in that particular course. The user then needs to subscribe to the event themselves to receive emails. They can select to get notifications for a specific choice only, or for all choice activities on the course.

was that the feedback and questionnaire module would provide this functionality at least roughly.

I have tested feedback so far and it does not provide what I would need, since it does not publish the results of each student right away:

Rationale:

Periodically I submit a set of exercise to my students which they have to solve, and they can pick up the exercise they want to work with.

Each question has limit 1, the results of the choice is published immediately with full names.
